page.title: 02ECOLOGY
page.content: {TOPOLOGY.}In the west the gravel ridge on which Southminster lies,has been extensively worked and now exhausted gravel pits have been used for infill and fishing.Eastwards, the land levels out. The oldest of Essex's reclaimed marshlands have an average height of 3metres. This land is now used for arable and dairy farming. {SOILS}In the West,terrace sands and glacial gravels.In the East London clay formed by river and marine alluvium. {CLIMATE.}North easterly winds in winter, often bring low temperatures. Summer temperatures in July and August 70F are often cooled by sea breezes whose velocity often exceeds 15mph.It has high annual sunshine hours and very low rainfall of 19ins.
